prompt: Create Cisco IOS XR 7.0.1 MDT configuration for hardware inventory/state: stream inventory entities and platform slot instance state. Use gRPC no TLS. Collector 192.0.2.196 port 57500. Sample every 10 minutes.
candidate:
telemetry model-driven
 sensor-group INVENTORY-ENTITIES
  sensor-path inventory/entitlements/entity
  sensor-path inventory/platform/slot/state
 !
 destination-group DG-GRPC
  address-family ipv4
   destination 192.0.2.196
    port 57500
    encoding self-describing-gpb
    protocol grpc no-tls
 !
 subscription INVENTORY-SUB
  sensor-group-id INVENTORY-ENTITIES sample-interval 600000
  destination-group-id DG-GRPC
 !
expected:
telemetry model-driven
 sensor-group INV-OPER
  sensor-path Cisco-IOS-XR-invmgr-oper:inventory/entities/entity
  sensor-path Cisco-IOS-XR-platform-oper:platform/racks/rack/slots/slot/instances/instance/state
 !
 subscription SUB-INV
  sensor-group-id INV-OPER sample-interval 600000
  destination-group-id DG-INV
 !
 destination-group DG-INV
  address-family ipv4 192.0.2.196 port 57500
   encoding self-describing-gpb
   protocol grpc no-tls
  !
 !
!
rationale: The candidate config correctly uses gRPC no TLS, the correct IP (192.0.2.196), and port (57500), and the encoding self-describing-gpb, meeting the hard requirements. However, the sensor-paths differ significantly from the expected ones: the candidate uses 'inventory/entitlements/entity' and 'inventory/platform/slot/state' which are not clearly related to the expected 'Cisco-IOS-XR-invmgr-oper:inventory/entities/entity' and 'Cisco-IOS-XR-platform-oper:platform/racks/rack/slots/slot/instances/instance/state'. The candidate's sensor-paths are less specific and may not capture the requested hardware inventory/state data accurately. Naming and ordering differences are acceptable, but the sensor-path mismatch reduces the score.
